questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of the YANG model?

choices.C: It is a distributed model of nodes.
choices.D: Spines are used to represent individual attributes of nodes.
choices.B: It uses containers to categorize related nodes.
choices.A: Associate types are optional for each leaf.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The network engineer is performing end-to-end MPLS path testing with these conditions:

• Users must perform MPLS OAM for all available same-cost paths from R1 to R4.
• Traceroute operations must return all of the next-hop IP details.

Which configuration meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
C is the answer

Using verbose knob in above command will list all the hops as below:
R1#traceroute mpls multipath ipv4 10.1.5.5 255.255.255.255 verbose

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/multiprotocol-label-switching-mpls/multiprotocol-label-switching-mpls/200097-MPLS-LSP-Multipath-Trace.html

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The network engineer who manages ASN 65001 must configure a BGP routing policy on GW-XR1 with these requirements:

• Advertise locally-originated routes and /24 prefixes assigned within the 198.18.0.0/15 range. All other prefixes must be dropped.
• Reachability to 198.18.100.0/24 must be preferred via the EDGE-1 connection.
• Reachability to 198.19.100.0/24 must be preferred via the EDGE-2 connection.

Which configuration must the network engineer implement on GW-XR1?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer: B

D: it doesn't have "eq 24"
C: if as-path is-local then
 done 
!!!! it stops further
A: for neighbor 10.201.0.1, as prepended for wrong set ACL=SET_2=192.168.19.0/24 and vice versa

Selected Answer: B
A- uses remote end AS to prepend and prepends the wrong SET (SET_2 should be prepend to Peer 1, SET_1 to Peer_2)
C - uses done/pass combination without drop:
 - if as-path is-local -> done [stops processing further]
 - but if it’s NOT local then moves to next if -> is part of 198.18.0.0/15 eq 24? if yes pass
 - but if it’s NOT part of that subnet -> is part of this prefix set?
 - but if it’s NOT part of that prefix -> then PASS (else done statement)
D - miss the eq 24 in the “if destination” statement so larger mask length can pass

Not C because 

if as-path is-local then 
DONE (in B it is PASS)
DONE - accepts prefix and STOPS processing but we want it to continue for the prepend as-path. 
PASS - allow the execution to continue

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

It is B, 
D say's 192.XXX/15 not with ge or le option so exact match cannot be true.

comments.content:
A - Prepend a incorrect AS_number to neighbors (64611 and 64612) 
C - has "ndif" instead of "endif"
D - don't match the correct prefix 192.18.0.0/15 eq 24

"B" it's the correct.
I don't see the "ndif" in C

discussion.content:
It is B.
 Destination-prefix is for flowspec.
https://community.cisco.com/t5/mpls/cisco-xr-rpl-destination-vs-destination-prefix/td-p/4587693

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer at a large ISP Is configuring telemetry streams to monitor the health status of PE routers on the network using gRPC dial-out. The PE routers are located at several data centers in different physical locations, and they are using IS-IS and BGP for routing. Which additional configuration must the engineer implement on the PE routers to meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D matches the destination group name

Selected Answer: D
D is correct one
Yes correct as the hierarchy is related to memory. Inventory manager option won't be for monitoring health status.

comments.content: D is the only option that selects the correct destination-id "DGroup2' from the exhibit.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is D

choices.B: Add configuration snmp-server user AuthUser group2 remote 10.1.1.1 v3 auth sha and use show snmp mib to verify the configuration.
choices.C: Add configuration snmp-server user AuthUser group2 remote 10.1.1.1 v3 auth sha and use show snmp engineid to verify the configuration.
choices.A: Add configuration snmp-server user UserJustMe GrpMonitoring v3 auth sha AuthPass1 priv 3des 128 PrivPass2 and use show snmp interface to verify the configuration.
choices.D: Add configuration snmp-server user UserJustMe GrpMonitoring v3 auth sha AuthPass1 priv aes 128 PrivPass2 and use show snmp view to verify the configuration.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must implement SNMPv3 on a Cisco IOS XR router running BGP. The engineer configures SNMPv3 to use SHA for authentication and AES for privacy on the routers, which are in a different data center in the same exchange as other routers. The engineer must also verify the associated MIB view family name, storage type, and status. Which set of actions meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Answer: D
B and C didn't use privacy, hence out
A and D are very close, however, A used privacy "3des" and D used prvacy "aes" as per question. Hence, D is correct.

D is correct

show snmp view
To display the configured views and the associated MIB view family name, storage type, and status, use the show snmp view command in EXEC mode.
